newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine peso down 5.5 pct to 27.84 pesos.
newsitem.headline: Philippine peso down 5.5 pct to 27.84 pesos.

text.p: The Philippine peso fell 5.5 percent in initial trades on Friday to 27.84 pesos to the dollar after the Central Bank announced it would allow the peso to move in a new, wider range, traders said.
The peso closed at 26.401 on Thursday.
Minutes after trading opened, the peso fell to 29 pesos with volume at $19 million.
The fall to 29 pesos from the early 27.84 came just before the Bankers Association of the Philippines (BAP) halted trades.
The BAP said trades had to be temporarily halted because the volatility band rule was breached. The peso is only allowed to move within 1 1/2 percent of a reference rate.

Allied Bank official Dan Lorenzo, the officer-in-charge for the day for the BAP deals, said he was yet to determine whether all the trades would be cancelled. Trades were at 27/29.45, with volume at $27 million.
He said the band was breached at 26.796.
